IBeforeRenderCb

IBeforeRenderCb: () => void
  • Defined in lib/reverse-infinite-scroll.ts:121

Callback which should be called AFTER additional data is gathered but BEFORE any state is updated which is used for re-render.

Type declaration

    • (): void

    • Returns void

IDataLoaderCb

IDataLoaderCb: (...args: any[]) => any
  • Defined in lib/data-loader.ts:57

Callback for loading additional data for scrollable HTML element. Arguments for this function are passed as second argument of useDataLoader hook.

    • Parameters

      • Rest ...args: any[]

ILoadMoreCb

ILoadMoreCb: (beforeRender: IBeforeRenderCb) => Promise<any>
  • Defined in lib/reverse-infinite-scroll.ts:116

Callback which would be called every time scroll is detected close to the top of container.

param

callback which should be called AFTER additional data is gathered but BEFORE any state is updated which is used for re-render.

returns

Promise which is resolved AFTER DOM is updated with additional data.

Type declaration

    • (beforeRender: IBeforeRenderCb): Promise<any>

    • Parameters

      • beforeRender: IBeforeRenderCb

      Returns Promise<any>

Functions

Const useChatScroll

  • useChatScroll(targetRef: MutableRefObject<Element>, data: any[], loadMoreCb: ILoadMoreCb, options?: IUseChatScrollOptions): IUseChatScrollReturn
    • Defined in lib/chat-scroll.ts:18

    React hook for making HTML element scroll behaved like chat. If scroll is at the bottom - it would stay there when new content is added. Infinite scroll behavior would kick in when scrolling up.

    Parameters

    • targetRef: MutableRefObject<Element>

      Reference of scrollable HTML element.

    • data: any[]

      Array of some data items displayed in a scrollable HTML element. It should normally come from a state.

    • loadMoreCb: ILoadMoreCb

      Callback for loading more data. It is very important to ensure that this callback does not issue a request if end of data is reached. Otherwise target server might be spammed with requests.

    • Optional options: IUseChatScrollOptions

      Additional options to customize hook behavior.

    Returns IUseChatScrollReturn

Const useDataLoader

  • useDataLoader(dataLoader: IDataLoaderCb, data: any[], setData: ISetDataCb, args?: any[]): ILoadMoreCb
    • Defined in lib/data-loader.ts:13

    React hook which creates a usable data loader for useInfiniteScroll hook. It is only useful if new data is always added to the beginning of the array. Should one need a different behavior or better optimization techniques - custom implementation would be needed.

    Parameters

    • dataLoader: IDataLoaderCb

      Data loader function to be converted into compatible callback for useDataLoader.

    • data: any[]

      Data to be shown in a scrollable HTML element.

    • setData: ISetDataCb

      Method for setting data into state.

    • Default value args: any[] = []

      Array of arguments to be passed to data loader

    Returns ILoadMoreCb

Const useStickyScroll

  • useStickyScroll(targetRef: MutableRefObject<Element>, data: any[], options?: IUseStickyScrollOptions): IUseStickyScrollResponse
    • Defined in lib/sticky-scroll.ts:9

    React hook for keeping HTML element scroll at the bottom when content updates (if it is already at the bottom).

    Parameters

    • targetRef: MutableRefObject<Element>

      Reference of scrollable HTML element.

    • data: any[]

      Array of some data items displayed in a scrollable HTML element. It should normally come from a state.

    • Optional options: IUseStickyScrollOptions

    Returns IUseStickyScrollResponse
